sentences.en: "I'll do it, Eleanor," Angus said, quickly jumping up. But this time she only shook her head. "I'll manage," she said firmly.
sentences.cn: 安格斯一跃而起道：“让我来，埃莉诺。”可是，这一次她只是摇了摇头，坚定地说：“我能应付。”

sentences.en: According to the British show jumping team manager, "It's a pig of a course — much too big and also very technical."
sentences.cn: 据英国场地障碍赛马队教练说，“整个赛场太大，对技术的要求也高，比赛起来很困难。”

sentences.en: Forgive me. I shouldn't be jumping to conclusions.
sentences.cn: 原谅我，我不该草率地下结论。

sentences.en: He gets vicarious thrills from watching people bungee jumping.
sentences.cn: 看到别人蹦极他感到了同样的刺激.

sentences.en: He had the duty receptionist almost jumping through hoops for him. But to no avail.
sentences.cn: 值班的接待员几乎为他费尽了力气，但还是没用。

sentences.en: His mind moves in quantum leaps, manipulating ideas and jumping on to new ones as soon as he can.
sentences.cn: 他的脑子飞快地转着，分析着各种想法，还不时冒出新的点子来。

sentences.en: I'd jumped seventeen feet six in the long jump, which was a school record.
sentences.cn: 我跳远曾跳了17.6英尺，这是个校纪录。

sentences.en: If you are eliminated in the show-jumping then you are out of the complete competition.
sentences.cn: 如果在马术障碍赛中被淘汰，就意味着完全出局。

sentences.en: Many farms are jumping on the bandwagon and advertising organically grown food.
sentences.cn: 很多农场正赶潮流宣传有机食品。

sentences.en: She suddenly became very vehement and agitated, jumping around and shouting.
sentences.cn: 她突然变得激动狂躁，四处乱跳还大喊大叫。

sentences.en: She was jumping up and down.
Stojanovic escaped their clutches by jumping from a moving vehicle.
sentences.cn: 斯托扬诺维奇从正在行驶的车上跳了下去，逃出了他们的掌心。

sentences.en: The red horse is jumping well.
sentences.cn: 这匹红马在这几跳中都跳得不错.

sentences.en: Then I noticed the car was bouncing up and down as if someone were jumping on it.
sentences.cn: 然后我注意到那辆车在上下颠簸，好像有人在车上蹦跳似的。

sentences.en: We saw a salmon jumping in the waterfall there.
sentences.cn: 我们看见一条大马哈鱼在那边瀑布中跳跃.

words.tran_cn: 跳高运动员；跳跃者；工作服；妇女穿的套头外衣

phrases.tran_cn: 欣然接受；跃向；急切地接受
偷跑；行动过早；[俚]未听发令枪就起跑

trans.tran_en: If you jump, you bend your knees, push against the ground with your feet, and move quickly upward into the air

trans.tran_cn: 跳( jump的现在分词 )，跳过，快速移动，（因吃惊、害怕或激动而）猛地一动
